edu.iastate.cs228.hw2

Class AbstractSorter

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.iastate.cs228.hw2.AbstractSorter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    InsertionSorter, MergeSorter, QuickSorter, SelectionSorter

    public abstract class AbstractSorter
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class is extended by SelectionSort, InsertionSort, MergeSort, and QuickSort. It stores the input (later the sorted) sequence.
    Author:
    Alex Huynh

        public void setReferencePoint(Point p)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • setComparator

        public void setComparator(int order)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Generates a comparator on the fly that compares by x-coordinate if order == 0, by y-coordinate if order == 1, and by polar angle with respect to referencePoint if order == 2. Assign the comparator to the variable pointComparator. If order == 2, the method cannot be called when referencePoint == null. Call setRereferencePoint() first to set referencePoint. Need to create an object of the PolarAngleComparator class and call the compareTo() method in the Point class.
        Parameters:
        order - 0 by x-coordinate 1 by y-coordinate 2 by polar angle w.r.t referencePoint
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if order is less than 0 or greater than 2 IllegalStateException if order == 2 and referencePoint == null;
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • sort

        public abstract void sort()
        Use the created pointComparator to conduct sorting. Ought to be protected. Made public for testing.

      • getMedian

        Obtain the point in the array points[] that has median index

        median point
